summary: This is an email chain from June 2019 between FBI Special Agent Michael A. Osborn and Assistant U.S. Attorney Laura Birger, with a third party (Russell) mentioned, discussing scheduling a meeting to talk about the plan for the Jeffrey Epstein case. The exchange shows coordination among law enforcement and prosecutors shortly before Epstein's July 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Michael A. Osborn
persons.context: FBI agent based in New York who is coordinating a meeting about the Epstein case; he mentions being in El Salvador and returning on Friday night.

persons.name: Laura Birger
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is requesting a meeting with Osborn and Russell to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Russell
persons.role: Unnamed individual (likely law enforcement or prosecutor)
persons.context: Mentioned by Laura Birger as someone who would also attend the planned meeting about the Epstein case; full name and role not specified in the text.

connections.description: Birger, a prosecutor, is coordinating a meeting with FBI agent Osborn to discuss the Epstein case plan, indicating they are working together on the investigation.
Birger mentions wanting to meet with Osborn and Russell together, suggesting Russell is a colleague or collaborator on the Epstein case.

events.title: Email request for Epstein case meeting
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Laura Birger emails FBI agent Michael Osborn requesting a meeting that week with her and Russell to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduling confirmation for Epstein case meeting
events.description: Final email in the chain confirms a meeting time of 11 AM on the following Thursday to discuss the Epstein matter.

locations: New York (implied from FBI NY and USANYS designations)
keyFacts: In June 2019, federal prosecutors and FBI agents were actively coordinating meetings to discuss the plan for the Jeffrey Epstein case, indicating ongoing investigative activity shortly before Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
FBI Special Agent Michael A. Osborn was traveling internationally (in El Salvador) while remaining engaged in case coordination, showing the multi-jurisdictional nature of the investigation.
The email chain involves at least three individuals (Osborn, Birger, and Russell) from law enforcement and prosecution teams planning strategy for the Epstein case.
